Event.description: platform: Wii U
Event.name: Mario Kart 8

Event.description: platform: Sega Megadrive
Event.name: Sonic The Hedgehog (Speed Run)

Event.description: See Tabletop HQ
Event.name: Board Games: A Game of Games

Event.description: Board Games
Event.name: New Game showcase

Event.description: Miniatures Gaming
Event.name: Iron Arena tournament
Board Games: Demo Games / Learn to Play

Event.description: Including Pathfinder Society, Shadowrun, Classic D&D, Fiasco, Leverage, Hunter Planet, Toon, FATE, Tiny Teddies Go To War, Dragon Age, Numenera.
Event.name: RPG: Demo Games / Learn to Play

Event.description: Including Super Dungeon Explore, DUST, Warhammer 40K, X-Wing, Warmachine/Hordes, Ronin/SAGA, Flames of War, MERCS
Event.name: Miniatures: Demo Games / Learn to Play

Event.description: Including Speed painting, Paint & take, Painting workshops
Event.name: Miniatures: Painting events

Event.description: Join Pete Hines, the Vice President of PR & Marketing at Bethesda Softworks, as he talks about his 15 years working on franchises such as The Elder Scrolls, Fallout and Wolfenstein. He's done everything from writing manuals to playtesting games to serving as the company's chief spokesman, and he's sure to have some unique stories to tell! -- Panelists: Pete Hines [Vice President of PR & Marketing, Bethesda Softworks]
Event.name: Storytime with Pete Hines

Event.description: Over the past five years, gamers have seen an explosion in the number and variety of video shows about gaming, from broadcast TV to YouTube stars to Twitch TV. The current generation of consoles give every gamer the ability and power to broadcast their play to the world. As gamers, why do we like to watch others play? What makes for compelling viewing? What tips can successful broadcasters pass on so that you too can build an audience? -- Panelists: Marc Fennell [Presenter, The Feed & Download this Show], Bajo [Presenter, Good Game], Hex [Presenter, Good Game], Michael Shanks [YouTube Creator TimTim Fed], Twitch TV Broadcaster
Event.name: Why watch when you can play?

Event.description: It's an outdated notion that being a Geek is something that you're supposed to ashamed of or even keep secret, yet somehow it's still prevalent in our society. We talk to a group of people who have not only embraced their Inner Geek but have chosen to make career out of it. -- Panelists: Skaidris Gunsmith [Beta Bar Founder, Beta Bar], Ben McKenzie [Comedian / MC, Shoalin Punk], Lawrence Leung [Comedian / Actor, "Lawrence Leung"], Eve Beauregard [Entertainer, CD Projekt RED], Bonnie Bradley [Beta Bar Founder, Beta Bar], Graeme Orr [Retro Arcade Bar Owner, Forgotten Worlds]
Event.name: Owning Your Geek

Event.description: platform: Playstation 4, Xbox One
Event.name: FIFA 15

Event.description: platform: Xbox 360
Event.name: Halo Anniversary

Event.description: What’s better than playing a fantasy video game? Living one. Have you ever wanted to be a valiant knight? A backstabbing rogue? A powerful mage? Now is the time to make those dreams a reality. -- Panelists: Join the owners, organisers and players of Swordcraft Ltd., Australia’s biggest LARP and battle game community as we discuss this ever growing pass time. How we started, what the future holds for LARP and Swordcraft in Australia, and how you too can become a part of the action.
Event.name: The Foam and the Fury - Swordcraft the LARP

Event.description: platform: Xbox One
Event.name: Kinect Sports Rivals

Event.description: platform: Xbox 360
Event.name: Ultra Street Fighter 4

Event.description: Media Molecule are responsible for creating Little Big Planet and Tearaway. They are the Triple A developers with the big heart - committed to developing games that immerse the player in beautiful virtual worlds that transcend age, gender and cultural differences. Key to the MM gaming experience is enabling the player to use their original tools to create their own game worlds. This panel will explore Mm's rationale to game design and building communities of like-minded gamers. -- Panelists: Gus "Goose" Ronald [Presenter, Good Game], Siobhan Reddy [Studio Director, Media Molecule], James Spafford [Community Manager, Media Molecule], Rex Crowle [Creative Lead, Media Molecule]
Event.name: Media Molecule - Ask us about our games!

Event.description: Board Games
Event.name: Ticket to Ride tournament

Event.description: It seems obvious that, when playing a game of skill, one attempts to win. Interestingly, this is often not the case, and even skilled gamers rarely analyze to any real depth the underlying mechanics and strategy of a given game. By deconstructing the games we play, you too can make them far less fun for yourself and beat the everliving hell out of your friends. We'll hit the theory pretty heavily, but also specific examples from games like "Stratego," "Settlers of Catan," and even "Football." -- Panelists: Brandon "Rym" DeCoster [Producer, GeekNights]
Event.name: How to Win Every Game

Event.description: 128 player cap
Event.name: UT 2004 Instagib

Event.description: Immediately after Storytime with Pete Hines, stick around for a Q&A session featuring Gabe and Tycho of Penny Arcade! Two mics, one heck of a time! Also note that if you can't make it to this panel, there's another one on Sunday in the Main Theatre. These guys are givers. They give. -- Panelists: Gabe and Tycho!
Event.name: Penny Arcade Q&A

Event.description: One of the most experienced and creative game development teams will sit down to share their process creating Halfbrick's newest game. The session will cover art, design and a bit of programming to give an overview of what it takes to create a successful game in today's mobile marketplace. -- Panelists: Phil Larsen [CMO, Halfbrick]
Event.name: How Halfbrick Makes Games

Event.description: With mass media exposure heightening the TableTop Effect, plus a rising tide in board games enthusiasm in an open global market, we've entered a Golden Age of Tabletop Gaming. TableTop producer and game designer Boyan Radakovich leads a discussion about why going analog is the hottest new trend in gaming! Learn how both TableTop, the award-winning show hosted and created by Wil Wheaton, and TableTop Day, an international gaming holiday, have empowered our global gaming community. Please join in! -- Panelists: Boyan Radakovich [Producer / Creative Director, Geek & Sundry / Gamesmith]
Event.name: The Golden Age of Tabletop Gaming

Event.description: Card Games
Event.name: Casual Sealed Magic Tournament

Event.description: Indie developers and YouTubers come together to look at the symbiotic relationship between independently developed games and online video content. Do the rapidly expanding success of YouTube and Twitch gaming channels and the huge variety and accessibility of indie games have an impact on one another? What will this mean for the future of both mediums? -- Panelists: Award winning developers and YouTube personalities totaling 200,000 subscribers and 35 million views join us for the discussion.
Event.name: Content Match: When YouTube and Indie Games Collide

Event.description: If you’re a fan of ABC TV’s Good Game and Spawn Point here’s your chance to ask presenters Bajo, Hex and Goose and the show’s creator Janet Carr just about anything about the shows and how they make them. The panel will be moderated by Paul Verhoeven. -- Panelists: Janet Carrr [Creator & Executive Producer, Good Game - ABC TV], Bajo [Presenter, Good Game - ABC TV], Hex [Presenter, Good Game - ABC TV], Goose [Presenter, Good Game - ABC TV], Paul Verhoeven [Steam Punks - ABC TV], Dave Callen [Good Game - ABC TV]
Event.name: Good Game: Ask Us Anything

Event.description: Well-constructed games are capable of engaging the audience such that we are transported into the shoes of fictitious characters that exist only in virtual worlds far from our own. Is it possible for us to harness this power to solve real-life issues? If so then, how? Join the Dr. Tanya Petrovich of Alzheimer's Australia Vic, RMIT's Dr. Lisa Dethridge and team behind the award-winning Virtual Dementia Experience and find out how gaming technologies can be used to solve serious issues. -- Panelists: Norman Wang [Art Lead, Opaque Multimedia], Dr. Tanya Petrovich [Business Development Manager, Alzheimer's Australia Vic], Phoebe Linsay [Learning Coordinator, Alzheimer's Australia Vic], Liam McGuire [Design Lead, Opaque Multimedia], Dr. Lisa Dethridge [Senior Lecturer, RMIT], Chris McKenzie [Developer, Independent Developer]
Event.name: Serious Games for Serious Issues: More Than Just Having Fun

Event.description: platform: Playstation 1
Event.name: Point Blank (High Score Challenge)

Event.description: Board Games
Event.name: Ticket to Ride final

Event.description: Miniatures Gaming
Event.name: X-Wing tournament

Event.description: Formed in 2001 with the online smash hit Red Vs Blue, Rooster Teeth has since grown into a Texan-sized production company, responsible for none other than Achievement Hunter, RWBY, The Gauntlet, Immersion, Slo-Mo Guys and plenty more. Join the Rooster Teeth staff as they go up on stage completely unprepared and wing it! -- Panelists: Jack Pattillo [Rooster Teeth/Achievement Hunter], Ray Narvaez, Jr [Rooster Teeth/Achievement Hunter]
Event.name: Rooster Teeth

Event.description: 128 player cap
Event.name: Trackmania United Forever

Event.description: platform: Xbox 360
Event.name: Tekken Tag Tournament 2

Event.description: Bring along your scariest voice and come be part of video game history. -- Panelists: At last year’s PAXAus, Mick Gordon recorded the audience for the Killer Instinct soundtrack.
Event.name: Music, Video Games, and YOU

Event.description: Following the popular panel of last year, we look back at the year in competitive gaming in Australia and overseas. The esports scene continues to grow, and how are things progressing here at home? -- Panelists: A panel of players, commentators, organisers and journalists dedicated to esports discuss the big events in Australia and overseas, how our pro players and teams are performing internationally, and the challenges facing this exciting part of gaming. Where to next? Audience participation a must!
Event.name: State of Play - Competitive Gaming and E-sports in Australia

Event.description: platform: Playstation 4, Xbox One
Event.name: Call of Duty Ghosts

Event.description: platform: Xbox 360
Event.name: Call of Duty: Black Ops 2

Event.description: At PAX last year we discussed being good gamer parents. This panel is about getting practical: how can we build support networks and communities to do real work at a local level to represent and encourage the positives that interactive entertainment offers growing minds? From geek parents to community leaders, this panel will share ideas, insights and advice on doing the real work of building better communities and opportunities for young geeks. -- Panelists: Seamus Byrne [Editor, Australia & Asia, CNET], Janet Carr [Creator, Good Game, ABC], Ron Curry [CEO, iGEA, iGEA], James 'Spaff' Spafford [Community Manager, Media Molecule], Prof Jeffrey Brand [Author, Digital Australia reports, Bond University]
Event.name: XP Initiative: helping young gamers grow up to be good geeks

Event.description: So have you ever thought about making games, but wanted to work on your own from start to finish? This panel is all about learning how these wonderful developers taught themselves a variety of skills to make the games that they wanted to make. Hear the tales of how they started, finished and all their troubles inbetween in order to become the developers that they are today. -- Panelists: Izzy Gramp [Developer, Independent], Ken Wong [Lead Designer, Ustwo Games], Alexander Bruce [Developer, Demruth], Adriel Wallick [Developer, Independent], Chris Johnson [Developer, Independent], Maize Wallin [Composer, Independent]
Event.name: Lone Rangers: DIY games

Event.description: Card Games
Event.name: Pokémon

Event.description: Card Games
Event.name: My Little Pony

Event.description: After the latest federal budget, many Australian “geeks" were upset about the cuts and lack of support to science, the arts, libraries, and tech. So, how can we express to the powers that be that we value our libraries and art galleries, our CSIROs, and Interactive Game Funds? Does slacktivism achieve anything? Are protests outdated? Can video games be an effective tool for political persuasion? Help us brainstorm positive ways to express our shared values to all sides of politics. -- Panelists: Adam Bandt [Member of Parliament, The Greens], Sue McKerracher [Executive Director, ALIA], Justin Halliday [Investment Manager, Screen Australia], Conor O'Kane [Lecturer, RMIT], Dr Fiona Tweedie [Organiser, GovHack Melbourne], Nicole Stark [Director, Disparity Games]
Event.name: Political Proactivism for Geeks

Event.description: Nintendo 3DS
Event.name: Mario Kart 7

Event.description: How can video games explore queer themes and stories? Why is it even a problem if they don't? What impact does the lacklustre depiction of LGBT characters have on gamers? Most importantly, what steps are developers taking to improve that representation in games? -- Panelists: Join a panel of experienced queer developers - ranging from indie to AAA - for an inside look at "gay games", LGBT content in mainstream titles, and the challenges of making games that represent the diversity of the people who play them.
Event.name: Queering Video Games: LGBT Representation and Why It Matters

Event.description: 15+ -- Panelists: Ever wondered how to publish a game for Xbox? What are the guidelines and framework required to make a great ID@Xbox game? Are you an Indie developer looking to break into Xbox platform development? Join Chris Charla from the ID@Xbox Programme along with other industry experts to find out how to build great games for the Xbox platform and discuss the best ways to get into Aussie game development.
Event.name: Developing for ID@Xbox

Event.description: 64 player cap
Event.name: Worms Revolution

Event.description: Wing Commander. Freelancer. Star Citizen. Chris Roberts is no stranger to the infinite blackness of space. But what is it that keeps drawing Roberts back? What is it like working with Mark Hamill to shoot full-motion video cutscenes? And just how did Star Citizen make $50 million without even being released? Find out as we join the veteran game designer to look to the stars. -- Panelists: Chris Roberts [Space Lord, Cloud Imperium Games], Daniel Hindes [Space Trucker, GameSpot], Nathan Cocks [Space Nomad, Freelance], Joab Gilroy [Space Drunkard, Freelance], Seamus Byrne [Space Dad, CNET]
Event.name: A Chat With Chris Roberts, The Original Wing Commander

Event.description: Games. Played by almost everyone in one form or another. Older than the written word, yet fuelling a Cambrian explosion of new cultural forms and technological innovation. But the cultural establishment has no room for them: Screen Australia just scrapped the only dedicated Federal support for videogames, and tabletop games have NEVER had a place on the agenda. Well, it's time the playful arts took their rightful place alongside performing, literary and visual arts. Come talk about how. -- Panelists: Philip Minchin [Founder & Director, Australian Play, Imagination & Learning Institute], Andrew Hiskens [Manager, Learning Services Division, State Library of Victoria (also National & State Libraries of Australasia)], Antony Reed [CEO, GDAA (Game Developers' Association of Australia)], Sue McKerracher [Executive Director, Australian Library & Information Association], Andrew Ekin-Smyth [Digital Media Manager, Arts Victoria], Nick Rappo [Business Development Manager, Good Games Distribution]
Event.name: Gamers Conquered the Mainstream… What's Next?

Event.description: platform: Xbox One
Event.name: Trials Fusion (Time Trials)

Event.description: platform: Xbox 360
Event.name: Dead or Alive 5 Ultimate

Event.description: platform: Commodore 64
Event.name: River Raid (High Score Challenge)

Event.description: While Skyrim and Fallout let you meticulously create a custom character, games such as Watch Dogs and InFamous put you in control of fully fleshed protagonist. Meanwhile Dragon Age 2 and Mass Effect offered an experience somewhere in between the two. Does a user-created character offer a more immersive gaming experience? Or does a pre-gen protagonist allow writers to tailor the story experience? Or do neither matter? We'll look at how differing character creation experiences can change a game. -- Panelists: Nic Healey [Senior editor, CNET], Jessica McDonell [Video Journalist, Gamespot], Rae Johnston [Presenter, Tech Space], Jeffrey Yohalem [Lead Writer, Ubisoft], Aidan Scanlan [Assistant Director of Design, Bioware], Rich Vogel [President, BattleCry Studios]
Event.name: The Customised Is Always Right: Pre-gen vs custom characters

Event.description: 15+ -- Panelists: Join Hi-Rez Studios as they dive into the design and development process behind the mythology themed, third-person MOBA Smite. Hear stories about the game's early development, design hits & misses, and how the community has helped Smite become the #3 MOBA worldwide. Plus, free exclusive skins!
Event.name: Designing Smite and Cracking the MOBA market

Event.description: With the quality bar for indie development rising globally—how do Australian indies get noticed on the worldwide stage? The creators of Antichamber, Armello, Duet, Framed and Hand of Fate discuss the challenges, journeys and rewards of becoming omnipresent indie rockstars. -- Panelists: Josh Boggs [Founder, Loveshack], Morgan Jaffit [Founder, Defiant Development], Trent Kusters [Founder, League of Geeks], Alexander Bruce [Founder, Demruth], Tom Greenaway [Founder, Kumobius]
Event.name: Indie Game Globetrotters

Event.description: Following on from our panel last year, we check back on Mac and iOS gaming to see if there have been any improvements made in the Apple gaming space. Is the Mac Pro a serious gaming machine? Has Steam improved the landscape? What does iOS 8 and Metal mean for iOS Gaming? Will there ever be native games on Apple TV? Or should we all just give up and build a Gaming PC? -- Panelists: Peter Wells [Editor, Reckoner], James Croft [Editor, Reckoner], Raj Deut [Contributor, Reckoner], Benny Ling [Editor, AppleTalk]
Event.name: Cupertino and Games

Event.description: What does it actually mean to work on a games publication? What are some of the realities of working on games magazines and websites? Join Hyper Magazine's Editor, Daniel Wilks, John Gillooly, Editor of PCPP, Cam Shea, Senior Editor of IGN Australia, Stephen Farrelly, Managing Editor of AusGamers, and full-time freelancers, Joab Gilroy and Katie Williams for a chat about the realities of the job and to answer some questions for those who are looking to get a foot in the door. -- Panelists: Daniel Wilks [Editor, Hyper], Cam Shea [Senior Editor, IGN], Stephen Farrelly [Managing Editor, AusGamers], John Gillooly [Editor, PC PowerPlay], Joab Gilroy [Freelance Writer, AusGamers], Katie Williams [Freelance Writer, IGN]
Event.name: The Realities of Writing About Games

Event.description: Developers from the Dragon Age: Inquisition team walk attendees through the evolution of BioWare’s storytelling over the past decade: How the studio and the gaming landscape have evolved, and their thoughts on why Dragon Age: Inquisition is the next step in Bioware’s goal of crafting the best stories you can play. -- Panelists: Aidan Scanlan [Assistant Director of Design, BioWare Edmonton], Mike Laidlaw [Creative Director (Dragon Age Franchise), BioWare Edmonton], Mark Wilson [Lead Technical Designer (Dragon Age: Inquisition), BioWare Edmonton]
Event.name: BioWare: Stories You Can Play

Event.description: platform: Xbox 360
Event.name: Halo 3

Event.description: Virtual Reality is fast becoming a household buzzword, but what is it all about? Has it not been around for ages? why is it only now getting traction? How will the popularity of VR impact the commercial space as we move into the future? What do we see as the next steps in VR technology? Come and hear some answers from some leading lights in the VR space from both an Australian and International perspective. Hear their insight into how they see the VR movement and what it has to offer for everyone. -- Panelists: Adrian Webb [Simulation Design Analyst, Australian Department of Defence], Tim Ruse [Co-Founder, Zero Latency], Sean Edwards [Director or Development, Shovsoft/Lucid VR], OculusVR Team [Oculus VR]
Event.name: Virtual Worlds: a look into the VR past, present and future

Event.description: Board Games
Event.name: Fische Fluppen Frikadellen Event

Event.description: Board Games
Event.name: Seven Wonders Tournament

Event.description: Mike Krahulik and the Thornwatch team discuss the game's systems, setting, and ongoing development.
Event.name: Thornwatch Panel

Event.description: Yes, you can make games too! Game developers can come from backgrounds in writing, psychology, biology, history, theatre—and we believe these perspectives enrich the games space. Hobbyists, hopefuls, students and superstars will learn how to seek opportunities—or create their own. Panelists, including console, mobile, AAA and indie developers, will share their unique path into the industry, offer advice and discuss how they want to see the industry grow: we want you to make games too! -- Panelists: Josh Caratelli [Gameplay Programmer, Josh "Carrot" Caratelli], Liam Esler [Production Coordinator, Surprise Attack], Timothy Best [Lead Designer, Mighty Games Group], Tony Parmenter [Associate Lecturer, SAE/QANTM], Ashley Zeldin [Creative Director, Adorkable Games]
Event.name: You Can Make Games Too!

Event.description: platform: Playstation 4, Xbox One
Event.name: UFC 15

Event.description: platform: Xbox 360
Event.name: Ultimate Marvel VS Capcom 3

Event.description: Board Games
Event.name: Munchkin Event

Event.description: Miniatures Gaming
Event.name: X-Wing tournament

Event.description: Pitch your card ideas to the creators of Cards Against Humanity and special guests. The best suggestions will go in the game, the worst suggestions will be mercilessly ridiculed. -- Panelists: Eli Halpern [Co-Creator, Cards Against Humanity], David Munk [Co-Creator, Cards Against Humanity], Claire Friedman [Experience Manager, Cards Against Humanity], Jenn Bane [Community Manager, Cards Against Humanity], David Pinsof [Co-Creator, Cards Against Humanity], Max Temkin [Co-Creator, Cards Against Humanity]
Event.name: Cards Against Humanity

Event.description: 32 player cap
Event.name: Kerbal Space Program

Event.description: Whether it's self aware parody of popular culture or just a platform for dick jokes, there’s no denying games are a powerful medium for comedy. But can comedy in games be pushed further? -- Panelists: A panel of comedians and writers will wade their way through the games industry in the pursuit of comedy. From ‘Conkers Bad Fur Day’ to ‘South Park: Stick of Truth’, we’ll look at what games have made us laugh the hardest and what games deserve to be laughed at.
Event.name: Talking Funny: Comedy and Video Games

Event.description: Halloween is upon us, and what better way to commemorate it by taking a delve into the horror game genre? Join a panel of experts from GameSpot, Bethesda Softworks, IRL Shooter, and Pixelpickle Games as they discuss what makes a horror game scary, and what it means to explore fear. -- Panelists: Zorine Te [Associate Editor, GameSpot], Pete Hines [President of PR & Marketing, Bethesda Softworks], Robert Dowling [Game Developer, Pixelpickle Games], Drew Hobbs [Writer and Game Director, IRL Shooter], Brian Hicks [Lead Producer, Bohemia Interactive]
Event.name: Halloween Horror Games Panel

Event.description: Board Games
Event.name: Werewolves and Friends Event (Coup / The Resistance etc)

Event.description: Board Games
Event.name: Seven Wonders Final

Event.description: Ever wondered what really goes on behind the closed doors of a development studio? Are publishers really the devil? Do journalists get paid in pizza? Why don't videogames ever look like their trailers? -- Panelists: Our panel of current and former game developers, marketers, publishers, journalists and community managers discuss the issues and answer your questions.
Event.name: What They Won't Tell You About Working in Videogames

Event.description: 'Fallout: Distress' is a short film based on the popular video game series 'Fallout' made in Australia by WA film crew Aura Filmworks. It tells the story of a lone wanderer walking the wasteland who stumbles across a distress call of a man in trouble. Come check out the premiere screening of 'Fallout: Distress' as attended by a panel of Writer/Director Jacob Trevaskis and main actor Joseph Corr. The panel will discuss the film itself, the future of video game films and the teams next projects. -- Panelists: Jacob Trevaskis [Writer/Director/Producer, Aura Filmworks], Joseph Corr [Actor/Writer, Aura Filmworks]
Event.name: Screening of Fallout fan film 'Fallout: Distress'

Event.description: Geek Bomb is heading to PAX and we're putting on a show! Join members of the Bomb Squad and Team Captains - TV Host Paul Verhoeven and Comedian Dave Callan as they battle it out TEAM VS TEAM in the ultimate showdown! But here's the catch - we need YOU! It's incredibly crowd interactive, and the winning team could need YOUR geeky knowledge? Do you accept? There will be prizes and giveaways! -- Panelists: Tegan Jones [Contributor, Geek Bomb], Nathan Bramley [Contributor, Geek Bomb], Sabre Jimmi [Contributor, Geek Bomb], Brad Weston [Contributor, Geek Bomb], Paul Verhoeven [Writer, Freelance], Dave Callan [Comedian]
Event.name: Geek Bomb's GEEK TRIVIA SHOWDOWN

Event.description: Our first night of concerts, you may feast upon the sounds of musical comedy duo Paul and Storm, followed by Tripod and the Melbourne Symphony Orchestra premiering their upcoming show 'This Gaming Life'
Event.name: Friday Night Concerts - Paul & Storm, Tripod

Event.description: 128 player cap
Event.name: Chivalry

Event.description: Come and hang out with the IGN Australia Pubcast crew as they talk games, film and a whole lot of shit. -- Panelists: Cam Shea [Senior Editor, IGN], Tristan Ogilvie [Video Editor, IGN], Lucy O'Brien [Entertainment Editor, IGN], Luke Reilly [Games Editor, IGN], Jem Gold [Freelance, All That Glitters], Ben Baker [Freelance, Chops.com]
Event.name: IGN AU Pubcast - Live!

Event.description: Do you want to conquer the challenges of indie board game backing and hunt fancy loot? Your party may be too small, the dungeon too ambitious, the loot may be swallowed in inexperience or lost in the sands of time. How about defeating the boss guarding game funding success? Self funding, crowd funding and publishing can be defeated with new fighting techniques. This panel has some leading Australian indie board game wizards who will share both sides of their experience with modern game funding. -- Panelists: Wesley Lamont [Managing Director, RAEZ], Phil Harding [Managing Director, Adventureland Games], Sean Carroll [Managing Director, 93 Made Games], Alex Bijk [Creative Director, Lab - Blue Room], Paul Nicholas [Creative Designer, Lab - Blue Room]
Event.name: Quest to fund Indie Board Games

Event.description: Running a horror roleplaying game is like telling a ghost story. When done right, the game leaves players laughing nervously for years afterwards. Three expert gamemasters and authors spill the brains on how to have fun freaking people out, covering atmosphere, plots, NPCs, and tentacles. Lots of tentacles. If you want to get more horror into any tabletop RPG or if you’re just Cthulhu curious, come along and share the scares. -- Panelists: Mark Morrison [Game designer, Campaign Coins], Rebecca Orth [GM, Freelance], Scott Vandervalk [GM, Freelance]
Event.name: Things that go bump on the tabletop

Event.description: Tonight, in Cosplay Stadium, we have the ultimate battle of our Iron Chef Cosplays! Iron Chef Sparkles (Aly), Iron Chef MDF (K), Iron Chef Ruffles (Siera) and Iron Chef Bondo (Andrew Cameron) will form two teams and have one hour to design and construct a cosplay from an unknown box of materials and craft supplies! Witness the extreme talent of some of Australia's best cosplayers as they battle it out to become the ultimate Iron Chef Cosplay. The hot glue gun will be on! -- Panelists: Kirsty Sculler [Promotions Manager, New Game Plus], Sylvester Ip [Product Manager, Madman], Christine Busby [K, Aly & K Cosplay], Alyssea Nicole [Aly, Aly & K Cosplay], Andrew Cameron [Director, Andrew Cameron Cosplay], Nikki Collis [Siera, ClamWings Cosplay]
Event.name: Iron Chef Cosplay
